sets.title: Unity (Animation, Asset Management, C# Scripting, Gameplay, Programming)

questions.question: What can you use to visually distinguish between Play mode and Design mode in the editor?
questions.answer: Play mode tint
correctAnswer: Play mode tint

questions.question:
A developer executes the C# code below, which finds any game objects tagged as "enemy" in a start event. But the developer notices that, when executed, FindGameObjectsWithTag returns NULL even though the scene contains objects tagged as "Enemy". What is a possible cause?
`GameObject[] MyEnemies = GameObject.FindGameObjectsWithTag("Enemy");`
questions.answer: The objects are deactivated
correctAnswer: The objects are deactivated
options: The objects are on the UI layer

questions.question: What does this code sample achieve? Float Answer = Random.value \* 10f;
questions.answer: It selects a random number between 0 and 10
correctAnswer: It selects a random number between 0 and 10
options: It selects a random number that is less than 10
It selects a random number greater than 10
It selects a random number between 0 and 10
It selects a random number that is multiple of 10

questions.question: Unity scenes may be saved entirely in the YAML format. Why might you do this?
questions.answer: To externally parse a scene and its objects
questions.explanation:
> Also, the text data can be generated and parsed by tools, making it possible to create and analyze scenes automatically.
> [Reference](https://docs.unity3d.com/2021.2/Documentation/Manual/TextSceneFormat.html)
correctAnswer: To externally parse a scene and its objects
options: To externally parse a scene and its objects
To optimize scene loading and unloading

questions.question: Which visual effects are removed by Orthographic cameras?
questions.answer: Foreshortening
questions.explanation:
Gamma color space and bloom are related to graphics. Depth of field is related to objects blurring when at a certain distance from the camera.
1. [Reference](https://docs.unity3d.com/2022.3/Documentation/Manual/CamerasOverview.html)
2. [Reference](https://pbr-book.org/3ed-2018/Camera_Models/Projective_Camera_Models#OrthographicCamera)
correctAnswer: Foreshortening

questions.question: What is Cinemachine Virtual Camera used for?
questions.answer: To create predefined camera presets to apply to standard cameras
questions.explanation:
> Use the Aim, Body, and Noise properties to specify how the Virtual Camera animates position, rotation, and other properties. The Virtual Camera applies these settings to the Unity Camera when Cinemachine Brain or Timeline transfers control of the Unity camera to the Virtual Camera.
> [Reference](https://docs.unity3d.com/Packages/com.unity.cinemachine@2.9/manual/CinemachineVirtualCamera.html)
correctAnswer: To create predefined camera presets to apply to standard cameras
options: To override standard scene cameras with cinematic behaviors
To determine what cameras will see when arriving at specific locations
To create predefined camera presets to apply to standard cameras
To act as dummy cameras for fooling meshes into thinking they are being seen

questions.question: What does the Microphone class save captured audio data as?
questions.answer: An audio clip asset
questions.explanation:
The Microphone class saves captured audio as an audio clip asset, which may then be stored as an OGG file.
[Reference](https://docs.unity3d.com/ScriptReference/Microphone.html)
correctAnswer: An audio clip asset

questions.question: Cinemachine offers tools for building gameplay behaviors. Which component makes spline-based paths for moving objects?
questions.answer: Cinemachine Smooth Path
correctAnswer: Cinemachine Smooth Path

questions.question: When building assets like meshes for Unity. Which measurement unit is the most suitable to use?
questions.answer: Meters
questions.explanation: [Reference](https://docs.unity3d.com/2019.3/Documentation/Manual/BestPracticeMakingBelievableVisuals1.html)Unity's default units are in meters (Unreal Engine too). If you keep this in mind and model with your units aligned to meters, the lighting system will work with minimal artifacts.
correctAnswer: Meters

questions.question: The Collaborate feature of Unity Teams empowers whom to do what.
questions.answer: Team members to save, share, and sync unity projects
correctAnswer: Team members to save, share, and sync unity projects
options: Developers to contribute to the unity source code
Companies to raise money for projects through crowdfunding
Team members to save, share, and sync unity projects
Developers to integrate version control systems, like git, into projects

questions.question: The Clear Flags property of the Camera components affects which behavior?
questions.answer: How the camera renders its background on each frame
correctAnswer: How the camera renders its background on each frame
options: How the camera renders UI objects on top of the scene
How the camera renders transparent objects by default
How the camera renders its background on each frame
How the camera occludes background objects

questions.question: What is the OnAnimatorMove event on MonoBehaviour objects commonly used for?
questions.answer: Modifying the root motion of an animated object
correctAnswer: Modifying the root motion of an animated object
options: Updating a navigation agent in response to keyframe data
Replaying an animation when it has been completed
Modifying the root motion of an animated object

questions.question: Which MonoBehaviour method runs by default in Editor mode?
questions.answer: Reset
questions.explanation: * Explain- The Reset method is a MonoBehaviour method that runs by default in Editor mode. This method is called when the script is attached to a GameObject or reset in the Inspector. It allows you to initialize or reset the values of variables in the script, ensuring a consistent initial state when working in the Unity Editor.
correctAnswer: Reset

questions.question: For the OnTriggerEnter function to invoke successfully on a collision between two objects, at least one must have which two components?
questions.answer: A Rigidbody and a Collider
correctAnswer: A Rigidbody and a Collider

questions.question: UI elements, such as images and buttons, may be fixed at specific screen positions to build responsive interfaces. Which Unity features help achieve this?
questions.answer: Anchors and pivots
correctAnswer: Anchors and pivots

questions.question: The occlusion map of a material is often a grayscale image with pixels ranging between black and white. What does this map contribute to an object’s material?
questions.answer: White pixels receive full indirect illumination, and black pixels receive none
correctAnswer: White pixels receive full indirect illumination, and black pixels receive none
options: White pixels reveal the detailed map and black pixels reveal none
White pixels allow emission, and black pixels allow none
White pixels receive shadows, and black pixels receive none
White pixels receive full indirect illumination, and black pixels receive none

questions.question: What can you use to organize different game objects into groups inside the Hierarchy panel?
questions.answer: Empty objects
correctAnswer: Empty objects

questions.question: The Project Windows search box can filter the display of assets with text commands. Which command displays only texture assets?
questions.answer: T:texture
correctAnswer: T:texture

questions.question: A bullet game object is fired from a weapon and travels quickly through the scene using a RigidBody component. It sometimes passes through solid objects even though they have colliders. What is a reasonable strategy for correcting this?
questions.answer: Change the Collision Detection property of the Rigidbody to Continuous Dynamic or Continous Speculative
correctAnswer: Change the Collision Detection property of the Rigidbody to Continuous Dynamic or Continous Speculative
options: Expand the collider size of all scene objects and the bullets to detect collisions with better time
Increase the Fixed Time Step value from the Project Settings dialog to change the frequency of the FixedUpdate event
Change the Collision Detection property of the Rigidbody to Continuous Dynamic or Continous Speculative
Enable the IsKinematic property of the Rigidbody

questions.question: Some material types may include normal map textures. What does a normal map achieve?
questions.answer: It creates the appearance of surface detail on mesh-like bumps, dents, and scratches
correctAnswer: It creates the appearance of surface detail on mesh-like bumps, dents, and scratches
options: It programmatically reduces the polycount of your meshes.
It displaces mesh geometry with extrusion and bevels to generate higher-poly versions.
It creates the appearance of surface detail on mesh-like bumps, dents, and scratches
It is a level-of-detail system that progressively reduces a mesh’s polygons as a scene camera moves farther away from it

questions.question: A SkinnedMeshRenderer component is attached automatically by Unity to some mesh objects when they are added to a scene. Which reason best explains why?
questions.answer: The mesh file contains bones and rig data
correctAnswer: The mesh file contains bones and rig data
options: The mesh file contains bones and rig data
The game object also features an animator component
The game object is a Player-Controlled character
The mesh file contains a humanoid character

questions.question: Which C# attribute can show a private variable in the object inspector?
questions.answer: SerializedField
questions.explanation: [Reference](https://docs.unity3d.com/ScriptReference/SerializeField.html)
correctAnswer: SerializedField

questions.question: What is a technique for optimizing Unity UI elements?
questions.answer: Group static UI elements on one canvas, and dynamic elements on a separate canvas
questions.explanation: [Reference](https://unity.com/how-to/unity-ui-optimization-tips) Every time an element on a canvas is updated, the whole canvas is redrawn. If elements are never being updated, keeping them on a single canvas is ideal.
correctAnswer: Group static UI elements on one canvas, and dynamic elements on a separate canvas
options: Group static UI elements on one canvas, and dynamic elements on a separate canvas
Position all canvas objects to the world origin
Group as many UI elements as possible onto only one canvas
Divide the screen into multiple canvas objects, each sized to a quarter of the screen size

questions.question:
What does the C# Space attribute used below achieve?
```c#
[Space(20)]
Public string PlayerName;
```
questions.answer: It inserts 20 pixels of empty space above the variable inside the Object Inspector
questions.explanation: [Reference](https://docs.unity3d.com/ScriptReference/SpaceAttribute.html) This is a great way to customize your inspector without writing a new inspector script for it.
correctAnswer: It inserts 20 pixels of empty space above the variable inside the Object Inspector
options: It inserts 20 space characters as a default value into the string variable below
It inserts 20 pixels of margin on all edges around the variable inside the Object Inspector
It inserts 20 pixels of empty space above the variable inside the Object Inspector
It inserts 20 pixels of empty space below the variable inside the Object Inspector

questions.question: Every time you double-click a C# script file from the Project window, Unity prints the message below (or something very similar) to the console. What is a reasonable step in trying to solve this? Cannot start the process because a file name has not been provided
questions.answer: Set Visual Studio as the code default editor via the External Tools tab of the Preferences menu
correctAnswer: Set Visual Studio as the code default editor via the External Tools tab of the Preferences menu
options: Search the Project windows for all script files and then rename all of them
Set Visual Studio as the code default editor via the External Tools tab of the Preferences menu
Ensure you have specified a Play mode tint color from the Colors tab of the Preferences menu
Select the Script file, and then select Assets > Find references in Scene from the Application menu

questions.question: What are the Console windows useful for?
questions.answer: Identifying errors in your script files and project
correctAnswer: Identifying errors in your script files and project
options: Downloading data packets and asset packages
Typing and executing command line instructions through a shell interface
Identifying errors in your script files and project

questions.question: Sprite atlas assets, large textures containing many smaller sprites, can be optimized by batching together what?
questions.answer: Sprites using the same color palette
correctAnswer: Sprites using the same color palette
options: Sprites using the same color palette

questions.question: You are making a game where you need to execute your own functions in response to critical animation events for a rigged character. Specifically, there are two events you must handle: when an animation state is entered and when it is exited in the Animator graph. Which class may be used to invoke your code when those two events happen?
questions.answer: StateMachineBehaviour
questions.explanation: [Reference](https://docs.unity3d.com/ScriptReference/StateMachineBehaviour.html) `OnStateMachineEnter()` and `OnStateMachineExit()` are the methods of the StateMachineBehavior class that handle this. AnimatorClipInfo displays information about the current clip being played, AnimatiorUtility deals with transform hierarchy, and AnimationInfo was removed in version 5.0.
correctAnswer: StateMachineBehaviour

questions.question: How can you change the unique bundle identifier for a mobile build?
questions.answer: Select Edit > Project Settings > Player from the menu, and then expand the Other Settings tab
correctAnswer: Select Edit > Project Settings > Player from the menu, and then expand the Other Settings tab
options: Select Assets > import Package, and then import the Cross-Platform Input Asset Package
Select Windows > Asset Management > Version Control, and then enter an identifier in the Source field
Select File > Build Settings. Then, from the Build dialog box, select Android or iOS, and select the Bundle Identifier from the Compression Method drop-down menu.
Select Edit > Project Settings > Player from the menu, and then expand the Other Settings tab

questions.question: Rigidbody components may be added to objects with colliders to make them affected by physical forces. What does the IsKinematic property achieve?
questions.answer: It suspends physical forces on the object, allowing manual transofrmations
correctAnswer: It suspends physical forces on the object, allowing manual transofrmations
options: It removes gravity from an object but retains all other forces
It removes all physical forces from the object, except gravity
It converts the object into physical forces that affect other objects
It suspends physical forces on the object, allowing manual transofrmations

questions.question: The primary directional light in a scene is linked by default to a procedural scene Skybox. What does the rotation of this light control?
questions.answer: The night and day status of the skybox
correctAnswer: The night and day status of the skybox
options: The night and day status of the skybox
The acoustics of all audio sources

questions.question: You can combine quaternions together through which arithmetic operation?
questions.answer: Multiplication
correctAnswer: Multiplication

questions.question: Which feature generates binary tree data to optimize camera rendering in a scene?
questions.answer: Occlusion Culling
correctAnswer: Occlusion Culling

questions.question: How does the Range C# attribute control the interaction behavior of numerical variables in the Object Inspector?
questions.answer: It restricts the variable value using a slider widget
correctAnswer: It restricts the variable value using a slider widget
options: It restricts the variable value using a slider widget
It validates the variable values through a text box widget
It restricts the variable values using a color picker widget
It presents valid options in a drop-down list
It blends the character's head animation with a second predefined animation
It makes the character's head face toward the specified target
It returns the character's head back to a neutral position
It makes a game object face toward the character's head

questions.question: The variable Transform.forward is a Vector3 measured in what?
questions.answer: Local space
correctAnswer: Local space

questions.question: De-lighting is associated with which technology?
questions.answer: Photogrammetry
questions.explanation:
`When you use photogrammetry to scan in models from the real world, and bring in those models into Unity (or any renderer), you will notice that the lighting information is baked into the texture. You can remove the baked in lighting information with various tools online, but even Unity themeless wrote a custom tool for just this; check it out!`
1. [Reference](https://github.com/Unity-Technologies/DeLightingTool)
2. [Reference](https://github.com/Unity-Technologies/DeLightingTool/blob/master/Assets/DeLightingTool/Documentation/De-LightingTool.pdf)
correctAnswer: Photogrammetry

questions.question: Humanoid character assets, like NPCs and the player character, feature on Avatar object. Which statement best describes its purpose?
questions.answer: Avatar facilitate animation retargeting across different humanoid characters
correctAnswer: Avatar facilitate animation retargeting across different humanoid characters
options: Avatars define parameter sets for facial muscle blendshapes
Avatar facilitate animation retargeting across different humanoid characters
Avatar define IK data for animated characters
Avatars describe how textures map on deforming objects during animation

questions.question:
You can perfectly align two mesh objects together at the vertices by using vertex snapping. How do you best access this tool?
![Vertex](images/Q39.png)
questions.answer: While holding down the V key, click and drag your object from a corner vertex to its destination
questions.explanation: [Reference](https://docs.unity3d.com/Manual/PositioningGameObjects.html#VtxSnapping)
correctAnswer: While holding down the V key, click and drag your object from a corner vertex to its destination
options: Select a mesh object and press the W key over the destination vertex
While holding down the C key, click and drag from the source to the destination mesh
Select **Edit > Enable Vertex Snap** from the menu, and then select your object
While holding down the V key, click and drag your object from a corner vertex to its destination

questions.question: Which statement best describes the function Quaternion.Euler?
questions.answer: It converts a 3D orientation that is measured in degrees into a Quaternion
questions.explanation:
Simplfying the math: Unity uses Quaternions internally to avoid Gimbal lock.
The Euler XYZ (Pitch, Yaw, and Roll) axises can lock up when two axies are aligned.
Quaternion.Euler converts the Euler number provided to the internally used Quarternion, to prevent this problem.
[Reference](https://docs.unity3d.com/ScriptReference/Quaternion.Euler.html)
correctAnswer: It converts a 3D orientation that is measured in degrees into a Quaternion
options: It prints a Quaternion to a string that shows its X, Y, and Z rotation in degrees
It converts a 3D orientation from Radiens to a Quaternion
It converts a 3D orientation that is measured in degrees into a Quaternion
It converts a Quaternion into a Vector3 in which X, Y, and Z are measured in degrees

questions.question: What does the Destroy function do?
questions.answer: It deletes the specified game object after the current update loop
questions.explanation: [Reference](https://docs.unity3d.com/ScriptReference/Object.Destroy.html)`The object obj is destroyed immediately after the current Update loop, or t seconds from now if a time is specified.`
correctAnswer: It deletes the specified game object after the current update loop
options: It deactivates the specified game object immidiately
It deletes the specified game object after the current update loop
It deletes the specified game object when the application terminates
It deletes the specified game object immidaitely

questions.question: You can programmatically control audio effects, like Pitch and Reverb, from C# scripts using which feature of an Audio Mixer asset?
questions.answer: exposed parameters
questions.explanation: [Official Unity Tutorial:](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9tqi1aXlcpE)`Audio attenuation is about energy loss, commonly refered to as "gain". ParamEQ allows you to change the frequency of the audio - "pitch", with no C# support. Audio Mixer groups do allow you to control audio effects, but not through C#.`
correctAnswer: exposed parameters

questions.question: Multiple animations may be mixed together on a single character, selectively on different limbs. Which Mecanim feature supports this?
questions.answer: avatar masks
questions.explanation: [Reference](https://docs.unity3d.com/Manual/class-AvatarMask.html)`Mip Maps are a technique that improves image quality and reduces rendering speed, at the cost of storage space, by including smaller copies of the image in the same file. Animation events allow you to call functions at points in the timeline.`
correctAnswer: avatar masks

questions.question: What does the PlayableDirector component allow you to do?
questions.answer: control the playback of a timeline instance in the scene
questions.explanation: [Reference](https://docs.unity3d.com/2019.2/Documentation/Manual/class-PlayableDirector.html)`The PlayableDirector component stores the link between a Timeline instance and a Timeline Asset.`
correctAnswer: control the playback of a timeline instance in the scene
options: run multiple functions on different game objects in parallel
switch between different scene cameras on demand
control the playback of a timeline instance in the scene
record a gameplay session to a video file

questions.question: What does the Grid component do?
questions.answer: helps you move objects to fixed grid increments
correctAnswer: helps you move objects to fixed grid increments
options: generate a grid sprite at world origin
helps you move objects to fixed grid increments
reders and isometric grid in the scene during gameplay
generates a grid mesh at the world origin

questions.question: Timeline sequences can initiate code during an animation using which feature?
questions.answer: markers
questions.explanation:
`EventSystem is not a timeline feature, neither are packets. Timeline signals are a subfeature of the markers, markers can directly initiate code, while a signal can only send the signal to a reciver.`
1. [Reference](https://forum.unity.com/threads/new-in-2019-1-marker-customization.594712)
2. [Reference](https://blog.unity.com/technology/how-to-create-custom-timeline-markers)
correctAnswer: markers

questions.question: Which code sample uses C# properties for creating the health functionality?
questions.answer: C
correctAnswer: C

questions.question: Which statement is not true?
questions.answer: C Only humanoid characters feature bones
questions.explanation: [Reference](https://docs.unity3d.com/2017.3/Documentation/Manual/GenericAnimations.html)
correctAnswer: C Only humanoid characters feature bones
options: A Coroutines will continue running on deactivated objects
B All component scripts inherit from `MonoBehaviour`
C Only humanoid characters feature bones
D The `Update` function is never called automatically while an object is deactivated

questions.question: When is the `Reset` method of `MonoBehaviour` invoked automatically?
questions.answer: B When adding a component to an object or resetting its values in Edit mode
questions.explanation: [Reference](https://docs.unity3d.com/ScriptReference/MonoBehaviour.Reset.html)`Reset` is called when the user hits the Reset button in the Inspector's context menu or when adding the component the first time. This function is only called in editor mode.
correctAnswer: B When adding a component to an object or resetting its values in Edit mode
options: A When a game object moves from one scene to another
B When adding a component to an object or resetting its values in Edit mode
C When a scene begins or is restarted
D When the scene begins or restarts for a deactivated game object

questions.question: Which C# attribute allows a class and its methods to run inside the editor during Edit mode?
questions.answer: D [ExecuteAlways]
questions.explanation:
`ExecuteAlways` makes instances of a script always execute, both as part of Play Mode and when editing. By default, MonoBehaviours are only executed in Play Mode and only if they are on GameObjects in the main stage containing the user Scenes. By adding this attribute, any instance of the MonoBehaviour will have its callback functions executed at all times.
1. [Reference](https://docs.unity3d.com/ScriptReference/ExecuteAlways.html)
Do not fall for `[RunInEditor]`! It looks similar to `MonoBehaviour.runInEditMode` and `[ExecuteInEditMode]` both of which are legit but not mentioned as possible answers.
2. [Reference](https://docs.unity3d.com/ScriptReference/MonoBehaviour-runInEditMode.html)
correctAnswer: D [ExecuteAlways]

questions.question: The `IsPointerOverGameObject` static function of the `EventSystem` class is useful for creating which behaviour?
questions.answer: C preventing mouse clicks on game objects behind the UI canvas <- i believe this is the correct answer but supervision would be helpful
correctAnswer: C preventing mouse clicks on game objects behind the UI canvas <- i believe this is the correct answer but supervision would be helpful
options: A moving UI elements in sync with the cursor as it drags across the screen
B changing the highlight of buttons as the cursor moves over them
C preventing mouse clicks on game objects behind the UI canvas <- i believe this is the correct answer but supervision would be helpful
D identifying which 3D object the cursor is hovering over

questions.question: Which C# code fragment continuously updates an object's yaw (Y rotation)?
questions.answer: `c# transform.Rotate(Vector3.right, RotSpeed * Time.deltaTime);`
correctAnswer: `c# transform.Rotate(Vector3.right, RotSpeed * Time.deltaTime);`

questions.question: What can you do to improve the searchability of your project's assets?
questions.answer: labels
correctAnswer: labels

questions.question: The Y keyboard shortcut activates which in-editor tool?
questions.answer: Rotate
correctAnswer: Rotate

questions.question: What does the Input.touchCount variable represent?
questions.answer: The number of touches currently present on the screen.
questions.explanation: [Reference](https://docs.unity3d.com/ScriptReference/Input-touchCount.html)
correctAnswer: The number of touches currently present on the screen.
options: The number of touches currently present on the screen.

questions.question: During gameplay, you need to serialize selected variables (data) of all enemies to send over a network for parsing to generate statistics about the current play session. Which Unity class helps convert object data to JSON text format?
questions.answer: JsonUtility
questions.explanation: [Reference](https://docs.unity3d.com/Manual/script-Serialization.html)
correctAnswer: JsonUtility

questions.question: Which texture format is generally avoided in Unity?
questions.answer: Uncompressed
questions.explanation:
[Reference](https://docs.unity3d.com/Manual/texture-compression-formats.html)
> `Observation`: I tested it in Unity itself and pressing it activated the rotate, scale and transform function, in the documentation (unity 2018.2) it says that it is a unified one, in the documentation of the most recent unity (2022.2) I did not find anything different
correctAnswer: Uncompressed
